description: An enormous ancient ship almost half the size of Fish-Man Island, built during the Void Century as part of a promise with Joy Boy. The ship was meant to be raised to the surface using Poseidon's powers for the mass migration of Fish-Man Island's citizens.

keyEvents.title: Luffy vs Hody Battle on Noah
keyEvents.description: The main battle between Luffy and Hody Jones takes place on the falling Noah.
keyEvents.significance: Primary location for the episode's action as the ship descends toward Fish-Man Island.

keyEvents.title: Air Bubble Destroyed
keyEvents.description: Hody destroys the air bubble surrounding Noah, flooding it with water.
keyEvents.significance: Transforms the battlefield conditions, putting Luffy at extreme disadvantage.

keyEvents.title: Noah's History Revealed
keyEvents.description: Neptune's flashback reveals Noah was built as part of an agreement with Joy Boy to use Poseidon's powers for mass migration to the surface.
keyEvents.significance: Reveals the ancient purpose and significance of the ship.

statusHistory.reason: Vander Decken IX threw Noah at Shirahoshi; ship is descending toward Fish-Man Island

description: An underwater island located 10,000 meters below sea level, beneath the Red Line. Home to both fish-men and merfolk, protected by a massive bubble. Currently threatened by the descending Noah.

keyEvents.title: Ammo Knights Prepare Air Bubble
keyEvents.description: The Ammo Knights work to prepare a massive air bubble to surround Noah on Fukaboshi's orders.
keyEvents.significance: Coordinated effort to save the island from destruction by the falling Noah.

keyEvents.title: Ancient Promise for Migration
keyEvents.description: Revealed that Fish-Man Island was part of an ancient agreement where its citizens would migrate to the surface using Noah and Poseidon's power.
keyEvents.significance: Explains the island's connection to ancient history and Joy Boy's promise.

statusHistory.reason: Noah is falling toward the island and could destroy it

description: A sunken ship graveyard at the bottom of Fish-Man Island where a Poneglyph containing Joy Boy's apology to the fish-men is located.

keyEvents.title: Joy Boy's Apology Poneglyph Referenced
keyEvents.description: The flashback references the Poneglyph in the Sea Forest containing Joy Boy's apology for breaking his promise.
keyEvents.significance: Connects to the broader mysteries of the Void Century and foreshadows Luffy's role in fulfilling the promise.
